bug.author: jlguardi
bug.summary: ML model loading fail doesn't generate empty pointer, so undetectable
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Please state the information for your system</denchmark-h>


OpenCV version: 3.1 and also dev version
Host OS: Linux (Ubuntu 16.04-64 bits)
Compiler & CMake: GCC 5.3.1 & CMake 3.5.1

<denchmark-h:h3>In which part of the OpenCV library you got the issue?</denchmark-h>


ML

<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behaviour</denchmark-h>

If file read fails while models loading, pointer should be empty().
<denchmark-h:h3>Actual behaviour</denchmark-h>

Pointer returns empty() == False
<denchmark-h:h3>Code example to reproduce the issue / Steps to reproduce the issue</denchmark-h>

Please try to give a full example which will compile as is.
<denchmark-code>#include "opencv2/core/core.hpp"
#include "opencv2/ml/ml.hpp"

using namespace std;
using namespace cv;
using namespace cv::ml;

int main( int argc, char *argv[] )
{
   Ptr<ANN_MLP> model = StatModel::load<ANN_MLP>("invalid_file");
   if( model.empty() )
       return 1;
   clog << "Should not be reached!" << endl;
   return 0;
}
</denchmark-code>
